name: InterContinental Hanoi Westlake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our tour provider selected this hotel…We stayed 4 nights. The location was good but a taxi ride from everywhere…At about 40-60,000VND (US$2-3) this did not bother us. The quality of the rooms was very good with all facilities. Room size was large and the view over Westlake exciting. Bed turndown service and refreshing of bathroom added “that little extra”. The service from the front door to check out was excellent and everyone very helpful. Internet in their business centre is pay as you go and not cheap. Breakfast service and variety again did not disappoint. A very good restaurant with low pricing and quality presentation of local style dishes is about a 50,000VND (US$2.50) taxi ride on the other side of the “quarter” and lake named the Quan An Ngon at 18 Phan Boi Chau. We walked there for a lunch from the Water Puppet Theatre.
reviews.title: Location a taxi ride from the”Quarter”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives:
reviews.title: Probably the best in Hanoi... but still can be improved!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: 1. Booked a "lake view room", and was expecting a view as suggested on website. The first room they took me to had a view of the some old hotel next door, complained and was told the lake view room I had booked was full, they showed me 2 other rooms which were similar which I rejected. Finally after speaking to the receptionist, they found a lake view room available. Sad that it took so much effort, as the view from this room was astonishing.
reviews.title: Phenomenal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: 2. The airconditioning/temperature control on the 4th day stopped working, and just would send out hot air. Complained and they fixed the heat problem. But the bathroom started flooding as water was leaking out the airconditioning vent on the ceiling. Despite the room being made up on the 5th day, this problem was not fixed, and the next morning the whole bathroom floor was flooded. Maid should have spotted this problem when making up the room or with the turndown service and fixed.
reviews.title: Cold & Lonely in Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. No heaters in the Sunset Bar. Very cold there in the evening. Maybe the hotel can buy some patio heaters or indoor heaters?
reviews.title: Luxury hotel at the Westlake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was part of a tour we were on through Uniworld. We were so very pleasantly surprised how cosmopolitan Hanoi is. The hotel rooms are enormous. The tub was extremely huge too.
reviews.title: Huge rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: After trying Sofitel and Daewoo as they were the closest to my office (the only purpose of my frequent trips to Hanoi was business), I got bored and did need some change.. I was told that Intercont had balconies which seemed indeed a remedy - to spend 2 weeks in a dusty humid city locked in a room without any chance to get a breeze of fresh air unless going outside the hotel was a disaste.. So, Intercont has overcome my expectations.
reviews.title: Island of ambience in the crazy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ambience on the lake... That is what you cannot expect from Hanoi famous for its noisy crowded streets. Great rooms - wooden floors, spacious bathroom and tropical shower - amongst the best ones I have ever seen in city hotels, and the price you pay for Intercont fully justifies itself. An, sure, french windows and spacious balcony overlooking the lake - you don't recongnize it's Hanoi, it gives you a feeling you are on vacation rather than on a business trip.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Pros: closer to the many other hotels - less than 40-45 minutes despite the traffic jam and road constructions; the atmosphere of the place - a m b i e n c e; the only (at least I haven't seen any) hotel in Hanoi with the balconies overlooking not a noisy street but a quiet lake, greatest value for money - it's indeed cheap for 5*, simple and sexy design of the rooms, bath & shower, wide selection of meals for a breakfast including pho bo soup, Sunset Bar with sofas in the open air (be careful with ordering Long Island - not sure whether it was the coctail but I had completely spoiled my next night and day after drinking it :))
reviews.title: This is a hotel where I will always stay when come to Ha Noi business trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: service - typical not very friendly for Hanoi unless you pay extra money, however cannot complain much about this; for those conscious about money the location can hardly be convenient - far from the city center and requires taking a taxi; quality of sleep - the lake brings even more humidity compared with the stay in the city center; whatever you do with air conditioner you will wake up sweated, however the air cons always worked very well; swimming pool is likely a bathtub rather than a pool - for a good swimming pool better choose Sofitel (which is cheaper though has no that fantastic Interconintal atmosphere)
reviews.title: Impeccable Westlake oasis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is set on a big sprawling place, beautifully built over the west lake. For rooms further away, they have a buggy service to bring you over. Very scenic and beautiful.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel set over beautiful West Lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room is very comfortable, very big bathroom and our balcony on the 2nd floor opens to a very nice view of the swimming pool and the lake.
reviews.title: What a pity!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a huge spread of mainly western stuff, nothing much to rave about. Hanoi has a of restaurants and street fare that offer really nice food at cheap prices.
reviews.title: Beautiful but cold service
My Favorite Hotel -- Ever
reviews.text: Staff were professional, but not warm. Overall, it was a great experience.

reviews.title: worst 5-star restaurant ever!
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my parents when they visited as it looks so great from the outside. It has amazing views over westlake and the rooms are very nice. It is however a great shame that it was like being in a ghost town and the service is not very good. For a new hotel I thought that their rates were very high and I noticed that if you book tours through their concierge they are expensive and unhelpful, it's cheaper to book directly through the agent that they use (Buffalo Tours) in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Intercontinental on our last day in Vietnam after 2 nights at Halong Bay. It is an extremely large hotel, but still felt comfortable. The rooms were excellent, with a fantastic shower and a deep relaxing bath. The bed was one of the most comfortable in Vietnam.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great shower and great bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food was very good, with an excellent breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Nicest hotel I have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The weather was overcast, so swimming was luckily out, as the pool was freezing.
reviews.title: Remote location, rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd recommend it.
reviews.title: Good value for luxury oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Me and two of my friends travelled the coast of Vietnam from North to South and this was our first hotel experience of Vietnam. The hotel was beautiful, the lobby was tastefully decorated and we received a warm welcome from the front desk staff. Our room was one over the lake and one of the porters took us over in a golf buggy type vehicle. The room was very large, clean and had a breathtaking view over the lake. The bathroom was also really big with a large walk in shower as well as a deep bath tub in which I enjoyed a long hot soak after three days constant travelling. The hotel is more on the outskirts of hanoi but is only a short and cheap taxi journey from the centre.
reviews.title: Nice & quiet luxury Hotel in Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have to admit that I was concerned at staying at a newly opened Hotel when it was booked but from the moment I arrived I had nothing to fear whatsoever. This new outstanding property seemed like it had been opened for years - so if you are concerned about this - don't be. This hotel really is an oasis in Hanoi - for those of you who have not visited Hanoi - it is wonderful but manic, noisy and chaotic. The hotel is perfectly situated on the lake and it is amazing to be able to return from a day in the city in just 5 minutes to this tranquil gem.
reviews.title: A new gem in Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel will appeal to all travellers whether on business or on holiday. All aspects of this hotel are just superb - the rooms very comfortable and extremely tastefully furnished, the public areas great, pool is beautiful, the sunset bar just the best place for a sundowner. I have to mention the faultless and impeccable service from the staff. A tip - if you can afford the surcharge, go for the club rooms with access to the club lounge - it's well worth it.
reviews.title: Looks Great, But Far Away, and Beware the Rip Off

likes.disliked: — Mosquitoes, Overpriced Internet, Language Problems, Distance from City

reviews.title: Perfect Location - Best hotel now in Hanoi
reviews.text: This hotel is run by Intercontinental and another concern of mine would be that it would have that feeling of a 'chain' hotel. Wrong again - this place is very exclusive and very individual whilst maintaining first class service in every corner. Whilst in Hanoi we visited the Metropole Hotel which I understand has been THE hotel in Hanoi for years - now there is a newcomer in my mind. I will of course not knock this Hotel but it is in the centre of noisy Hanoi and had although has it's colonial 'charm' it looks to have perhaps had it's glory years now...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: i stayed at the hotel 28-31 january 2008
reviews.title: great new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: check in was very friendly but a bit slow - was escorted up to my room and shown all the features - the staff are justly proud of their beautiful new hotel
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was spacious and decorated in a very attractive contemporary style - very comfortable huge bed , excellent bed-linen - large flat screen tv
reviews.title: Had a great visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bathroom was huge with a seaparate shower/bath - excellent elemis toiletries
reviews.title: Very good experience

likes.disliked: — Gym wasn't built, breakfast service experiencing teething problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: large balcony with amazing views over the swimming pool , and the lake
reviews.title: Gorgeous New 5 Star Hotel In Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably the best InterCon in the world. Certainly the best of about a dozen that I have been to.
reviews.title: Likely the best InterCon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is located north of Hanoi city centre on the shore of Westlake. This is an excellent location. The view is great and the atmosphere is tranquil, which is a very welcome respite from the intensity of Hanoi itself. The hotel is conveniently located on the way from the airport to Hanoi centre (about a 40 min ride). Centre Hanoi itself is only a 10 min ride away by taxi, which are always ready by the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Most rooms are located either over the water or in the main building with views over the lake and the Hanoi skyline in the distance. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. However, what really blew us away was the food. The breakfast is simply legendary both in terms of variety and quality. The Saigon restaurant is great for dinner. The only weak spot was the Diplomat lounge, where the burgers and sandwiches were quite subpar.
reviews.title: Tranquil location, rooms getting tired, can get expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And after all that, the pricing for the rooms is very reasonable, which is just icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Serene and Tranquil Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What lovely rooms in a charming hotel, try and get a room facing the lake and on the ground floor. Location is a bit out of the way. Service is excellent and the portions in the restaurants are "american size", so order sensibly. Breakfast spread is a bit sparse, but forgivable. Not having WIFI in the rooms is however shocking...i asked and they said all wireless routers were being used..just not good enough. will i go again, absolutely!
reviews.title: Will be great if...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful property entirely set on stilts on the Westlake. Well-trained service staff, although some seemed to be struggling with English. Didn't mind though as the attitude to service was good. We got an upgrade to the westlake view room upon check-in.
reviews.title: Wonderful Westlake Experience

likes.disliked: — Lack of free internet and having to pay for DVD player rental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice pool, although a bit small for a hotel this size. This didn't affect our stay though because it seemed the hotel was well below capacity. Very cute tanning beds with a partial covering to shield your face.
reviews.title: City Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great room service - fast and good food. Drinks by the pool and in the lounge were also great.
reviews.title: Great hotel offering excellent value for money

likes.liked: — the friendly staff and service provided - outstanding
likes.disliked: — one smaller issue i had with the room service which was rectified by the hotel right away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sunset Bar was cute and great for picture taking.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Everything - could not choose - service was fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall, a sanctuary in overly noisy Hanoi. Only gripe is you'll have to enter the Old Quarter for non-hotel food and shopping.
reviews.title: A GREAT New InterContinental Hotel in Vietnam

description: The new InterContinental Westlake Hanoi overlooks the 800-year-old Golden Lotus Pagoda on Hanoi's largest lake. It is the only hotel in Vietnam to be featured on CondÃ© Nast Traveler s 2008 Hot List, garnering the honour for a sublime waterfront locale. The historic city centre is within a 10-minute ride, as is a wide range of shopping and cultural venues. The hotel is just 40 minutes by taxi from Noi Bai International Airport.
